markdown:
**[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14)): DC 50 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 48 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 45 [Ran-To (Level 20)](/NPCs.aspx?ID=1527) **Source** [Pathfinder #168: King of the Mountain](/Sources.aspx?ID=87) pg. 54 **Perception** +33; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12) **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Goblin](/Languages.aspx?ID=6), [Tien](/Languages.aspx?ID=43), [Ysoki](/Languages.aspx?ID=61) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +32, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +41, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +34, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16) +32, [Warfare Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8) +32 **Str** +7 **Dex** +4 **Con** +5 **Int** +2 **Wis** +3 **Cha** +1 **Items** _+3 [major striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=280) gauntlet_, _+3 [major striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=280) [halfling sling staff](/Weapons.aspx?ID=78)_ (20 bullets and 5 [_greater explosive bullets_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=162)), _+3 [greater resilient](/Equipment.aspx?ID=279) [studded leather armor](/Armor.aspx?ID=5)_ --- **AC** 44 **Fort** +36 **Ref** +33 **Will** +30 +3 status to all saves vs. [evocation](/Traits.aspx?ID=65) **HP** 460 **[Attack of Opportunity](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=3)** When a creature triggers Ran-to's Attack of Opportunity, he can attempt an [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) check to [Grapple](/Actions.aspx?ID=35) the triggering creature instead of making a melee Strike. He can still disrupt a triggering [manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=104) action if he critically succeeds at his attempt. --- **Speed** 25 feet, fly 60 feet **Melee** _gauntlet_ +40 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Free-Hand](/Traits.aspx?ID=181), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103)), **Damage** 4d4+21 bludgeoning plus [Improved Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=27) **Body Slam** **Requirements** Ran-to is [grabbing](/Conditions.aspx?ID=20) a creature; **Effect** Ran-to throws his foe against the ground. The grabbed creature takes 12d6 bludgeoning damage (DC 43 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Fortitude save) and is knocked prone. The creature is no longer grabbed. **[Constrict](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=10)** 7d4+5 bludgeoning, DC 43 **Major Leaping Catch** Ran-to leaps from the ground and attempts to grab a foe while he soars. He makes a [Leap](/Actions.aspx?ID=81), [High Jump](/Actions.aspx?ID=36), or [Long Jump](/Actions.aspx?ID=37). His maximum distance is 100 feet. He must succeed at an [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) check to perform the leap as usual, but regardless of the type of leap the DC is equal to half the number of feet he moves in the air. Ran-to can attempt an Athletics check to [Grapple](/Actions.aspx?ID=35) at any point during the jump. Immediately after the attempt, he (and the creature, if the Grapple was successful) falls to the ground. Ran-to takes no falling damage when using this ability, but the grabbed creature takes the appropriate amount of falling damage as if it had fallen the distance moved. Ran-to can spend three actions to use this ability instead of two; if he does, he can use Plummeting Fall to add 12d6 bludgeoning damage to the falling damage dealt to the grabbed creature, and the creature is knocked [prone](/Conditions.aspx?ID=31). **Plummeting Fall** ([Certain Kill](/Traits.aspx?ID=384)) **Frequency** once per round; **Requirements** Ran-to has a creature [grabbed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=20) and the creature is airborne; **Effect** Ran-to spins and increases the force of gravity, sending him and the creature to the ground. The target takes 12d6 bludgeoning damage from the fall and is knocked [prone](/Conditions.aspx?ID=31); Ran-to is unharmed. **Titan Wrestler** Ran-to can attempt to [Disarm](/Actions.aspx?ID=41), [Grapple](/Actions.aspx?ID=35), [Shove](/Actions.aspx?ID=38), or [Trip](/Actions.aspx?ID=40) creatures, regardless of their size. **Whirlwind Toss** **Frequency** once per round; **Requirements** Ran-to has a creature [grabbed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=20); **Effect** Ran-to spins the creature he's holding, smashing it against any creatures within his reach, then throws the creature aside. Ran-to attempts an [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) check against the grabbed creature's Fortitude DC. Regardless of the result, the creature is no longer grabbed after this activity.
**Critical Success** Ran-to tosses his foe mightily. The grabbed creature is [thrown](/Rules.aspx?ID=451) into a space within 20 feet, takes 16d6 bludgeoning damage, and falls [prone](/Conditions.aspx?ID=31). All creatures adjacent to Ran-to take the same amount of bludgeoning damage (DC 43 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save).
**Success** As critical success, except the grabbed creature is thrown into a space within 10 feet, and creatures take 12d6 bludgeoning damage.
**Failure** Ran-to tosses his foe aside. The grabbed creature falls prone.
**Critical Failure** Ran-to loses hold of his foe.
name: Ran-To (Level 20)

He can still disrupt a triggering manipulate action if he critically succeeds at his attempt. --- Speed 25 feet, fly 60 feet Melee Single Action gauntlet +40 (Agile, Free-Hand, Magical), Damage 4d4+21 bludgeoning plus Improved Grab Body Slam Single Action Requirements Ran-to is grabbing a creature; Effect Ran-to throws his foe against the ground. The grabbed creature takes 12d6 bludgeoning damage (DC 43 basic Fortitude save) and is knocked prone. The creature is no longer grabbed. Constrict Single Action 7d4+5 bludgeoning, DC 43 Major Leaping Catch Two Actions Ran-to leaps from the ground and attempts to grab a foe while he soars. He makes a Leap, High Jump, or Long Jump. His maximum distance is 100 feet. He must succeed at an Athletics check to perform the leap as usual, but regardless of the type of leap the DC is equal to half the number of feet he moves in the air. Ran-to can attempt an Athletics check to Grapple at any point during the jump. Immediately after the attempt, he (and the creature, if the Grapple was successful) falls to the ground. Plummeting Fall Single Action (Certain Kill) Frequency once per round; Requirements Ran-to has a creature grabbed and the creature is airborne; Effect Ran-to spins and increases the force of gravity, sending him and the creature to the ground. The target takes 12d6 bludgeoning damage from the fall and is knocked prone; Ran-to is unharmed. Whirlwind Toss Three Actions Frequency once per round; Requirements Ran-to has a creature grabbed; Effect Ran-to spins the creature he's holding, smashing it against any creatures within his reach, then throws the creature aside. Ran-to attempts an Athletics check against the grabbed creature's Fortitude DC. Regardless of the result, the creature is no longer grabbed after this activity. Critical Success Ran-to tosses his foe mightily. The grabbed creature is thrown into a space within 20 feet, takes 16d6 bludgeoning damage, and falls prone. All creatures adjacent to Ran-to take the same amount of bludgeoning damage (DC 43 basic Reflex save). Success As critical success, except the grabbed creature is thrown into a space within 10 feet, and creatures take 12d6 bludgeoning damage. Failure Ran-to tosses his foe aside. The grabbed creature falls prone. Critical Failure Ran-to loses hold of his foe.
